result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant appearing, Atty Benavides states defendant is not ready to plead today, matter to be reset, 4:34 P.M.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2019 at 01:00 pm.

1:25 p.m. Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Benavides stated defendant was caught in road construction and now has flat tire. State requested a warrant forth with. If picked up, defendant to be held until she can go before Judge Voigt. Defendant has the balance of today to appear in court.

ADA Jordan Lippert appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Atty Ron Benavides.  Defendant does not want jury trial but requests a new plea hearing date at separate time to arrange transfer to LaCrosse County.  Court summarizes case history.  ADA Lippert states analyst is unavailable for jury trial tomorrow and requests jury trial be taken off calendar.  Court states matter will be reset but if misses new court date, high cash bond will be set to keep defendant in custody.  Plea/argued sentencing June 17, 2019 @ 1:00 pm
